20110119220829.000|20110119220831.000|TR0|You know, there are two ways to do it.  
20110119220831.000|20110119220833.000|TR0|You either translate, you know, 
20110119220833.000|20110119220836.000|TR0|simultaneously, as they say things, or 
20110119220836.000|20110119220838.000|TR0|consecutively, after they say a bit, then

20110119221603.000|20110119221605.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN CONTRIBUTOR:  Forget 
20110119221605.000|20110119221608.000|TR0|the romance languages, if you really want 
20110119221608.000|20110119221610.000|TR0|your child to be ready for the future, you 
20110119221610.000|20110119221612.000|TR0|might want him to crack open some Chinese 
20110119221612.000|20110119221614.000|TR0|language textbooks.  As President Obama 
20110119221614.000|20110119221616.000|TR0|meets with Chinese President Hu Jintao at 
20110119221616.000|20110119221619.000|TR0|the White House this week, there are more 
20110119221619.000|20110119221621.000|TR0|and more reasons than ever to believe that 
20110119221621.000|20110119221623.000|TR0|China may hold the key to all of our 
20110119221623.000|20110119221625.000|TR0|futures.
20110119221625.000|20110119221627.000|TR0|
20110119221627.000|20110119221630.000|TR0|For starters, China owns a lot of us right 
20110119221630.000|20110119221632.000|TR0|now -- or soon will, as they continue to 
20110119221632.000|20110119221634.000|TR0|buy up use a -- U.S. Treasury bonds.  
20110119221634.000|20110119221636.000|TR0|China is now the largest foreign holder of 
20110119221636.000|20110119221638.000|TR0|U.S. debt, just under $900 billion worth.  
20110119221638.000|20110119221641.000|TR0|The Chinese have a significant financial 
20110119221641.000|20110119221643.000|TR0|stake in many other countries around the 
20110119221643.000|20110119221645.000|TR0|world, too.  It was reported this week 
20110119221645.000|20110119221647.000|TR0|that China has lent more money to 
20110119221647.000|20110119221649.000|TR0|developing countries in the last two years 
20110119221649.000|20110119221652.000|TR0|than the World Bank.
20110119221652.000|20110119221654.000|TR0|
20110119221654.000|20110119221656.000|TR0|Then there's their military expansion.  
20110119221656.000|20110119221658.000|TR0|Chinese military spending up 12 percent 
20110119221658.000|20110119221700.000|TR0|over the last decade.  A Chinese-developed 
20110119221700.000|20110119221703.000|TR0|stealth fighter jet recently took its 
20110119221703.000|20110119221705.000|TR0|first flight, they have created a long 
20110119221705.000|20110119221707.000|TR0|range missile that can hit U.S. ships in 
20110119221707.000|20110119221709.000|TR0|the Pacific, and they are building their 
20110119221709.000|20110119221712.000|TR0|first aircraft carrier to launch missions 
20110119221712.000|20110119221714.000|TR0|far from China's coastline.
20110119221714.000|20110119221716.000|TR0|
20110119221716.000|20110119221718.000|TR0|There's more.  Beijing has become an 
20110119221718.000|20110119221720.000|TR0|integral player in every major 
20110119221720.000|20110119221723.000|TR0|international issue, whether it's 
20110119221723.000|20110119221725.000|TR0|standoffs with North Korea and Iran or 
20110119221725.000|20110119221727.000|TR0|global warming.  In fact, one top NASA 
20110119221727.000|20110119221729.000|TR0|scientist says that China is the world's 
20110119221729.000|20110119221731.000|TR0|best hope in the fight against global 
20110119221731.000|20110119221734.000|TR0|warming. He says, our democracy, including

20110119221736.000|20110119221738.000|TR0|industry, makes it virtually impossible

20110119221740.000|20110119221742.000|TR0|issue of global warming.

20110119221835.000|20110119221837.000|TR0|Hi, Wolf.
20110119221837.000|20110119221840.000|TR0|
20110119221840.000|20110119221842.000|TR0|Year after year water pipes across the 
20110119221842.000|20110119221844.000|TR0|country with bursting at alarming rates 
20110119221844.000|20110119221846.000|TR0|and now with city budgets being slashed, 
20110119221846.000|20110119221848.000|TR0|there's not enough money to do anything 
20110119221848.000|20110119221851.000|TR0|more than band-aid repairs and the $10 
20110119221851.000|20110119221853.000|TR0|billion from the Obama administration 
20110119221853.000|20110119221855.000|TR0|stimulus package is just a drop in the 
20110119221855.000|20110119221857.000|TR0|bucket.  Now it's not a question of if 
20110119221857.000|20110119221900.000|TR0|their aging pipes will give out but when.
20110119221900.000|20110119221902.000|TR0|
20110119221902.000|20110119221904.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20110119221904.000|20110119221906.000|TR0|
20110119221906.000|20110119221908.000|TR0|KOSIK (voice-over):  It's a common sight 
20110119221908.000|20110119221911.000|TR0|this winter, water mains bursting with the 
20110119221911.000|20110119221913.000|TR0|changing temperatures.  But it's not just 
20110119221913.000|20110119221915.000|TR0|the freezing weather that's to blame.  All 
20110119221915.000|20110119221917.000|TR0|across the country, the network of pipes 
20110119221917.000|20110119221919.000|TR0|and pumps that bring water in and out of 
20110119221919.000|20110119221922.000|TR0|our homes and businesses is literally 
20110119221922.000|20110119221924.000|TR0|crumbling, falling apart.
20110119221924.000|20110119221926.000|TR0|
20110119221926.000|20110119221928.000|TR0|(on camera):  When all was said and done 
20110119221928.000|20110119221930.000|TR0|when the water was gushing out, how high 
20110119221930.000|20110119221933.000|TR0|did the water get in this basement?
20110119221933.000|20110119221935.000|TR0|

20110119221937.000|20110119221939.000|TR0|filled it.
20110119221939.000|20110119221941.000|TR0|
20110119221941.000|20110119221944.000|TR0|KOSIK (voice-over):  This summer, we 
20110119221944.000|20110119221946.000|TR0|traveled to Maryland to see what happened

20110119221950.000|20110119221952.000|TR0|Dundalk, Maryland blasting millions of 
20110119221952.000|20110119221955.000|TR0|gallons of water on to the streets and 
20110119221955.000|20110119221957.000|TR0|right into the Kramer's finished basement.
20110119221957.000|20110119221959.000|TR0|
20110119221959.000|20110119222001.000|TR0|(on camera):  Before this flood, this was 
20110119222001.000|20110119222003.000|TR0|a finished kitchen, wasn't it?
20110119222003.000|20110119222006.000|TR0|
20110119222006.000|20110119222008.000|TR0|KRAMER:  It was, it was.
20110119222008.000|20110119222010.000|TR0|
20110119222010.000|20110119222012.000|TR0|KOSIK:  And now what is it?
20110119222012.000|20110119222014.000|TR0|
20110119222014.000|20110119222017.000|TR0|KRAMER:  Nothing.  It's nothing.  It's 
20110119222017.000|20110119222019.000|TR0|just a space now, so it's start from 
20110119222019.000|20110119222021.000|TR0|square one again.
20110119222021.000|20110119222023.000|TR0|
20110119222023.000|20110119222025.000|TR0|KOSIK:  It's right here underneath this 
20110119222025.000|20110119222028.000|TR0|street where the six-foot water main broke 
20110119222028.000|20110119222030.000|TR0|here in Dundalk unleashing a flood of 
20110119222030.000|20110119222032.000|TR0|water.
20110119222032.000|20110119222034.000|TR0|
20110119222034.000|20110119222037.000|TR0|The pipe looked a lot like this.  Seems 
20110119222037.000|20110119222039.000|TR0|pretty sturdy, but over time it became 
20110119222039.000|20110119222041.000|TR0|very fragile.
20110119222041.000|20110119222043.000|TR0|
20110119222043.000|20110119222045.000|TR0|That's because the water pipes sitting 
20110119222045.000|20110119222048.000|TR0|underground have to hold up under extreme 
20110119222048.000|20110119222050.000|TR0|temperature changes, not to mention the 
20110119222050.000|20110119222052.000|TR0|constant flow of traffic running over it.
20110119222052.000|20110119222054.000|TR0|
20110119222054.000|20110119222056.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The American Water Works 
20110119222056.000|20110119222059.000|TR0|Association says every two minutes a water 
20110119222059.000|20110119222101.000|TR0|main breaks in the U.S., adding up to 
20110119222101.000|20110119222103.000|TR0|300,000 breaks each year.
20110119222103.000|20110119222105.000|TR0|
20110119222105.000|20110119222107.000|TR0|ERIC GOLDSTEIN, NATIONAL RESOURCE DEFENSE 
20110119222107.000|20110119222110.000|TR0|COUNCIL:  A large part of this system was

20110119222112.000|20110119222114.000|TR0|War II. Now it's time to replace that

20110119222149.000|20110119222151.000|TR0|flooded famous Ventura Boulevard.
20110119222151.000|20110119222154.000|TR0|

20110119224005.000|20110119224007.000|TR0|
20110119224007.000|20110119224009.000|TR0|TODD (voice-over):  At the White House, 
20110119224009.000|20110119224011.000|TR0|the dignified pageantry of a state visit 
20110119224011.000|20110119224014.000|TR0|for China's president, Hu Jintao.  But 
20110119224014.000|20110119224016.000|TR0|just under the surface, smoldering 
20110119224016.000|20110119224018.000|TR0|resentment towards the Chinese in the 
20110119224018.000|20110119224020.000|TR0|halls of American government and business, 
20110119224020.000|20110119224022.000|TR0|accusations of currency manipulation, 
20110119224022.000|20110119224025.000|TR0|unfair barriers to American businesses in 
20110119224025.000|20110119224027.000|TR0|China, and American products being copied 
20110119224027.000|20110119224029.000|TR0|or ripped off.  Bootlegged DVDs of the 
20110119224029.000|20110119224031.000|TR0|latest Hollywood releases are sometimes 
20110119224031.000|20110119224033.000|TR0|available on Chinese streets before they 
20110119224033.000|20110119224036.000|TR0|even open in American theaters.  American 
20110119224036.000|20110119224038.000|TR0|companies developing electronics, 
20110119224038.000|20110119224040.000|TR0|prescription drugs and software have 
20110119224040.000|20110119224042.000|TR0|similar complaints.
20110119224042.000|20110119224044.000|TR0|
20110119224044.000|20110119224047.000|TR0|(on camera):  The Chinese government even 
20110119224047.000|20110119224049.000|TR0|engages in some of this practice, right?
20110119224049.000|20110119224051.000|TR0|
20110119224051.000|20110119224053.000|TR0|FRED BERGSTEN, PETERSON INSTITUTE FOR 
20110119224053.000|20110119224055.000|TR0|INTERNATIONAL ECONOMICS: The Chinese 
20110119224055.000|20110119224058.000|TR0|government has laws that protect 
20110119224058.000|20110119224100.000|TR0|intellectual property, but in practice, 
20110119224100.000|20110119224102.000|TR0|enforcement is very lax.  And in some 
20110119224102.000|20110119224104.000|TR0|cases, Chinese government agencies, 
20110119224104.000|20110119224107.000|TR0|including military agencies, will 
20110119224107.000|20110119224109.000|TR0|sometimes rip off the intellectual 
20110119224109.000|20110119224111.000|TR0|property themselves.
20110119224111.000|20110119224113.000|TR0|
20110119224113.000|20110119224115.000|TR0|TODD (voice-over):  Fred Bergsten of the 
20110119224115.000|20110119224118.000|TR0|Peterson Institute says the Chinese steal 
20110119224118.000|20110119224120.000|TR0|American intellectual property by reverse 
20110119224120.000|20110119224122.000|TR0|engineering, buying American products, 
20110119224122.000|20110119224124.000|TR0|figuring out how they're put together.  
20110119224124.000|20110119224126.000|TR0|Then they make those parts themselves at a 
20110119224126.000|20110119224129.000|TR0|cheaper cost.
20110119224129.000|20110119224131.000|TR0|
20110119224131.000|20110119224133.000|TR0|Then there are complaints about China's 
20110119224133.000|20110119224135.000|TR0|trade rules.  Take a company like Marlin 
20110119224135.000|20110119224137.000|TR0|Steel Products in Baltimore, where 20 
20110119224137.000|20110119224140.000|TR0|percent of revenue comes from exports.  
20110119224140.000|20110119224142.000|TR0|Company president Drew Greenblatt says 
20110119224142.000|20110119224144.000|TR0|he'd like to export to China, but the 
20110119224144.000|20110119224146.000|TR0|Chinese have a rule that many products 
20110119224146.000|20110119224148.000|TR0|sold to government agencies there, or 
20110119224148.000|20110119224151.000|TR0|which get tax breaks, have to be made 
20110119224151.000|20110119224153.000|TR0|completely in China.  Known as the 
20110119224153.000|20110119224155.000|TR0|`indigenous innovation policy," it stacks 
20110119224155.000|20110119224157.000|TR0|the deck against American companies like 
20110119224157.000|20110119224159.000|TR0|Marlin Steel.
20110119224159.000|20110119224202.000|TR0|
20110119224202.000|20110119224204.000|TR0|DREW GREENBLATT, MARLIN STEEL WIRE

20110119224206.000|20110119224208.000|TR0|many challenges that they make for 
20110119224208.000|20110119224210.000|TR0|American factories that it's very 
20110119224210.000|20110119224213.000|TR0|difficult to export to China.
20110119224213.000|20110119224215.000|TR0|
20110119224215.000|20110119224217.000|TR0|TODD:  There's a direct impact, he says,
